Hello | First name |

We are now starting to send educational videos to better address what you can learn about CoPilot. We'll prepare and send these videos based on the suggestions we get most widely, so everyone else can also benefit from this knowledge.

Today's video is about how we use your data when you use CoPilot. Understandably, there were questions regarding data security, and we want to address these concerns even more explicitly in our forthcoming videos.

Watch the video below to learn more about our commitment to keeping your data secure and ensuring no AI is ever being trained on your data.

How does CoPilot use your data?

This video explains how we handle your data when you use CoPilot.

activitySummary: The user is actively engaged in editing an email on HubSpot. The email content is focused on educational videos for Jive CoPilot users, addressing data security concerns and explaining how CoPilot uses user data. The user is making sure the email is well-formatted and includes a video link for further information. This activity is crucial for ensuring that the communication is clear and informative for the recipients.

The user is also engaged in a chat conversation on Gmail with a colleague named Regina Nogueira. The conversation involves sharing logos and icons for videos. The user asks Regina for feedback on a video playlist created for customers, indicating a collaborative effort to ensure the quality and relevance of the content being shared with customers.

The user has a calendar open on the right side of the screen, showing a detailed schedule with various meetings and check-ins. This includes product daily check-ins, team weekly syncs, and innovation-focused days. This indicates that the user is managing their time effectively and is involved in multiple collaborative activities throughout the week.
aiUseSummary: There is no evidence of AI tools being used in the provided screenshots. The user is primarily engaged in email editing and chatting with a colleague. No AI chat interfaces or AI-generated content are visible in the screenshots, indicating that the user is not utilizing AI tools for their current tasks.
